issue.title: Unnessecary Whitelists in uBlock Origin Lists

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.50.1b6

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://fireemblem.fandom.com/wiki/Fire_Emblem_Wiki

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, EasyList, EasyPrivacy, Fanboy's Annoyances, Peter Lowe's Blocklist, Online Malicious URL Blocklist, Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List, Legitimate URL Shortener

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Copying from https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/18726

AdGuard Ads has its own whitelist. Unfortunately, this whitelist bypasses things that uBlock can fix via redirects.

For example, AdGuard Ads has the following filter: `@@||c.amazon-adsystem.com/aax2/apstag.js$from=fandom.com`. This filter overrides `||amazon-adsystem.com/*/apstag.js$script,redirect-rule=amazon_apstag.js:5` in the uBlock filters – Unbreak list, despite the site in question (fandom) functioning perfectly fine without the whitelist.


This is one example, but there's probably more.


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: A cosmetic filter is not applied if DNS filters list is enabled.
issue.body:
### Please answer the following questions for yourself before submitting an issue.

- [X] I am running the latest version
- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed

### AdGuard version

4.0

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Android 13 (OneUI 5.1)
- Device: Samsung Galaxy A34 5G
```


### Root access

- [ ] Yes, I have it.

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, List-KR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Strip URLs of tracking parameters, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Disable WebRTC, Block Push API, Block Location API, Remove X-client-Data header from HTTP request, Protect from DPI

### Issue Details

Steps to reproduce:
1. Clear cache, cookie and site data of a web browser and restart the web browser entirely.
2. Enable DNS filtering and AdGuard DNS filters list in DNS filtering module.
3. Visit https://lastpass.com/

### Expected Behavior

The element matching `iframe[src^="https://cdn.lmiutil.com/"]` are hidden as AdGuard DNS filters list is disabled.


### Actual Behavior

Even if `lastpass.com##iframe[src^="https://cdn.lmiutil.com/"]` filter is applied, the leftover still appears.

### Screenshots

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Screenshot_20230622_192037_Kiwi Browser](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForAndroid/assets/98787049/ef1cd47e-93c2-4e66-8d2e-c55b34562bca)


</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2:</summary>

![Screenshot_20230622_192122_AdGuard](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForAndroid/assets/98787049/4e43beac-f9bf-4945-a545-51c405d6a1db)


</details>

### Additional Information

 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/154305
